titleStmt.title: Princeton Ethiopic Manuscript No. 33: Prayer of Peter (Sälotä Petros), Prayer of Mary At Golgotha (Zä-Säne Golgota), Mystagogia (Təməhrətä Həbu'a)

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

msIdentifier.idno: Princeton Ethiopic Manuscript No. 33: Prayer of Peter (Sälotä Petros), Prayer of Mary At Golgotha (Zä-Säne Golgota), Mystagogia (Təməhrətä Həbu'a)

summary.p: Illustration: Fol. 81v: Magical charts based on the name of Ananəya, one of the three holy children rescued from the furnace.
Fols. 9r, 10r, 12rv, 16rv, 17v passim: The owner's name, Wäldä Maryam, appears at the end of every prayer.
Part of the seal states in Ge'ez "Conquering Lion of the Tribe of Judah. Menelik the King of Kings of Ethiopia."
Fols. 14v, 24v, 34v, 44v, 54v, 64v, 74v, 84v, 94v, 103r, 113r, 123r, 133r: Quires are marked with Ethiopic numerals: quire 1, 2, etc.
Fol. 35r: The daily readings were marked but erased (except on this folio) on the relevant pages at the top of the folio.
References: See references listed in manuscript no. 7, 11, 13.

msItem.title: Prayer of Mary At Golgotha, Zä-Säne Golgota
